commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found:
E117 over-indented
E501 line too long
E741 ambiguous variable name 'l'
W605 invalid escape sequence

Blacklist:
W503 line break before binary operator
W504 line break after binary operator

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Change-Id: I5d11a1f87d9547d9b6a27bf1f79cd69e0f73c741

commit_message:
Expect python3 client package in CentOS8

In CentOS, we expect to have python3 client package in 8.x while we
expect to have python2 in 7.x .
Fix unit tests to expect the correct version according to os major
version.

Change-Id: I0d56fa9d9a323017d53062d4779dd916816fd0ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-congress refs/changes/84/716284/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
hardware: 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' requires 'limits' argument

The 'NUMATopologyLimits' object, and dictionary representations of same,
are how nova considers host specific RAM and CPU overcommit ratios when
trying to determine whether an instance will fit on a host (in the
'NUMATopologyFilter' scheduler filter) and to actually fit the instance
to the host. They must always be provided and defaulting these to 'None'
makes this confusing. Remove the default value and add type hints for
future reference.

Part of blueprint use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: Iae063c1e67fdf0093ed6549e339287d7daa7265c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/02/714702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.pci import stats if instance_cell.memory > host_cell.avail_memory:def _numa_fit_instance_cell( host_cell: 'objects.NUMACell', instance_cell: 'objects.InstanceNUMACell', limits: 'objects.NUMATopologyLimit', cpuset_reserved: int = 0, ) -> ty.Optional['objects.InstanceNUMACell']: :param limits: An objects.NUMATopologyLimit containing host CPU and memory overcommit ratios :param cpuset_reserved: An int to indicate the number of CPUs overhead; currently this will only be either 0 or 1. else: # SHARED ram_limit = host_cell.memory * limits.ram_allocation_ratio cpu_usage = host_cell.cpu_usage + len(instance_cell.cpuset) cpu_limit = len(host_cell.cpuset) * limits.cpu_allocation_ratio host_topology: 'objects.NUMATopology', instance_topology: 'objects.InstanceNUMATopology', limits: 'objects.NUMATopologyLimits', pci_requests: ty.Optional['objects.InstancePCIRequests'] = None, pci_stats: ty.Optional[stats.PciDeviceStats] = None, ) -> 'objects.InstanceNUMATopology': if len(host_topology) < len(instance_topology): if 'network_metadata' in limits: host_cell, instance_cell, limits, cpuset_reserved, )
deleted_lines: if host_cell.avail_memory < instance_cell.memory:def _numa_fit_instance_cell(host_cell, instance_cell, limit_cell=None, cpuset_reserved=0): :param limit_cell: an objects.NUMATopologyLimit or None :param cpuset_reserved: An int to indicate the number of CPUs overhead elif limit_cell: cpu_usage = host_cell.cpu_usage + len(instance_cell.cpuset) cpu_limit = len(host_cell.cpuset) * limit_cell.cpu_allocation_ratio ram_limit = host_cell.memory * limit_cell.ram_allocation_ratio host_topology, instance_topology, limits=None, pci_requests=None, pci_stats=None): elif len(host_topology) < len(instance_topology): if limits and 'network_metadata' in limits: host_cell, instance_cell, limits, cpuset_reserved)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: If73e70bf2bb396ef30b4f38d315bbc284f5bef9f
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
[OpenStackAnsible] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I121b241b4457459dbfe4edfd42af08162fa076e2

revisions:

commit_message:
Oslo releases for 2020-03-30

Major for castellan because one of the changes removes a public member
from some of their modules. Feature for oslo.vmware because I think
the change has an implied dependency bump on the Glance client, even
though the client is passed in and not explicitly listed in the
requirements file.

Change-Id: I9ad3b891c09dab47e38de4d77dcea6d3b1516bf8

commit_message:
Live log for SoftwareDeployment scripts

At present, when heat-container-agent is executing SoftwareDeployment
scripts, the output of this is not visible to the cluster administrator
until the execution is complete. This is an unhelpful behaviour, as it
is far more useful to see what is happening in real time. This change
logs output to files under /var/log/heat-config/heat-config-script/.
Also keep origin logs so we can make sure we won't break backward
compatibility.

reference: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707694/

Change-Id: I56f7a7b9d404e7e1162c0992463cbab583ae6782

added_lines: import selectLOGS_DIR = os.environ.get('HEAT_SCRIPT_LOGS', '/var/log/heat-config/heat-config-script') def prepare_dir(path, mode=0o700): if not os.path.isdir(path): os.makedirs(path, mode) prepare_dir(LOGS_DIR, mode=0o644) suffix = c.get('name', '') suffix = '-%s' % suffix if suffix else '' lp = os.path.join(LOGS_DIR, '%s%s.log' % (c['id'], suffix)) log.debug('Running %s, logging to %s' % (fn, lp)) stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, env=env) with open(lp, 'w') as f: while subproc.poll() is None: read, _, _ = select.select([subproc.stdout], [], []) for stream in read: if stream: line = stream.readline().decode('utf-8', 'replace') f.write(line) f.flush()
deleted_lines: def prepare_dir(path): if not os.path.isdir(path): os.makedirs(path, 0o700) log.debug('Running %s' % fn) stderr=subprocess.PIPE, env=env) stdout, stderr = subproc.communicate() log.info(stdout) log.debug(stderr) 'deploy_stdout': stdout.decode('utf-8', 'replace'), 'deploy_stderr': stderr.decode('utf-8', 'replace'),

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I2de669d8e89b8daeb7ee5405ffab35af6307c40b

The routers cleanup lists ports for each router and tries to remove a
subnet. Remove listed port instead.

commit_message:
sahara: skip failing unit tests

The newer SQLAlchemy version that is required by master causes
unit test failures in sahara that are being investigated here:

https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007450

Change-Id: I4d7dcf9566b7ce58eea8e6ffd67dc979de46901b

commit_message:
Optimize DVR related port DB query

Save order by in port query when not require fixed_ips,
and save some useless query for dvr subnet mac.

Closes-Bug: #1834308

  FrozenDict and iterators. Generators are still a problem and this
  new function takes care of that separately, assuming that any
  generator is just a special iterator and hence represents a
  collection, i.e. a list in JSON terms. It works for all the cases
  we've encountered so far working with YAQL.
* Used the new function "utils.to_json_str()" everywhere for JSON
  serialization, including the action "std.http".
* Added necessary unit tests.

commit_message:
Fix serialization of structures that might contain YAQL types

* When YAQL output data conversion is disabled there's still
  an issue caused by presence of not JSON-compatible types within
  a YAQL result. The internal Mistral code is already able to deal
  with that (due to the previous changes) by checking that and
  converting them to what's needed. However, JSON serialization
  may still not work if it's done via the standard "json" library.
  The library simply doesn't handle those non-standard types and
  raises an exception. We have a sanitizing function that all YAQL
  results go through, however, it doesn't make sense to do recursive
  sanitizing for performance reasons. It does make sense to convert
  data as late as possible to avoid redundant data manipulations. So
  the sanitizing function handles only the root object in the object
  graph. The solution for this problem is to use our own utility
  function based on the "oslo_serialization.jsonutils" that is able
  to deal with at least part of the mentioned types, specifically
  FrozenDict and iterators. Generators are still a problem and this
  new function takes care of that separately, assuming that any
  generator is just a special iterator and hence represents a
  collection, i.e. a list in JSON terms. It works for all the cases
  we've encountered so far working with YAQL.
* Used the new function "utils.to_json_str()" everywhere for JSON
  serialization, including the action "std.http".
* Added necessary unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1869168
Depends-On: I1081a44a6f305eb1dfe68a5bad30110385130725
Change-Id: I9e73ea7cbba215c3e1d174b5189be27c640c4d42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/16/714416/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from yaql.language import expressions as yaql_expr @mock.patch.object(yaql_expr.Statement, 'evaluate') def test_iterator_result(self, mocked): mocked.return_value = iter([1, 2, 3]) # The goal of the test is just to check that the YAQL result # sanitizing works. That's why the main 'evaluate' function # in YAQL gets mocked and here we can pass anything. res = self._evaluator.evaluate('any_expr', None) self.assertIsInstance(res, list) self.assertEqual(3, len(res)) self.assertListEqual([1, 2, 3], res)

commit_message:
Bump oslo.serialization version to 2.21.1

* Starting version 2.21.1 oslo.serialization adds the parameter
  "fallback" to its "jsonutils.to_primitive" method. We need it
  to address some issue related to JSON serialization.

Change-Id: I1081a44a6f305eb1dfe68a5bad30110385130725

commit_message:
Fix Exception string arguments

Need to use % for arguments to Exception().

W0715: Exception arguments suggest string formatting might
       be intended (raising-format-tuple)

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I1afc2e4a3b34e548247e8a499fe45602454f36f5

commit_message:
Pick stale amphora randomly

Avoid getting the same amphora all the time if its loadbalancer
stuck in PENDING state and could not be failovered.

Story: 2007340
Task: 38877

Change-Id: I2f680a00be695c3828166e6803882765af79b79e
(cherry picked from commit 0f7d03feca4e3a4796c9c1a5a55d8da2adc44ebd)

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I95a8d8cf02a0cb923418c0b5655442b8d7bc6b08
Closes-Bug: #1863021
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/58/716058/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active # global variable. See https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1863021 and # https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592 import __original_module_threading as orig_threading import threading orig_threading.current_thread.__globals__['_active'] = threading._active

commit_message:
Normalize the 'undercloud-passwords.conf' return data

This change normalizes our client return formation by ensuring we're always
using the configured output path as defined within our constants.

Closes-Bug: #1868619

Change-Id: Ied051214c4d3f2a695d58a6cde6180f040ca02d4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Default IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE to dib

We limit the use of tinyipa to the most intensive jobs:
standalone
grenade
multinode

Also leaving ironic-tempest-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa
running for now as there could be an issue with the
ironic-python-agent

Story: 2007356
Task: 38908

Change-Id: Ieb1ea1dbeeb68b15e9281d154358336006b62214

commit_message:
Introduce 'MIXED' CPU allocation policy for instance

Currently we have 'DEDICATED' and 'SHARED' policies for instance CPU
allocation from host CPUs. 'MIXED' is another CPU allcation policy
for the instance obtaining some 'dedicated' CPUs, that's pinning to
particular host CPU and used exclusively by the instance, and some
'sharing' host CPUs, which will be sharing with other instances.

Also introduce the interface of flavor extra spec 'hw:dedicated_cpus'
for specifiying the bitmask of 'dedicated' instance CPUs.

Change-Id: Ide2eab6dfb0d2100d0f5501ed2a4070b9201320f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/713354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # for instance with pinned and unpinned CPUs, it requires host with # 'cpu_dedicated_set' and 'cpu_shared_set' configuration if (instance.numa_topology and instance.numa_topology.cpu_pinning_requested and instance.numa_topology.cpu_sharing_requested): if (not CONF.compute.cpu_dedicated_set or not CONF.compute.cpu_shared_set): msg = _("This host has instance requesting both pinned " "CPUs and unpinned CPUs but hasn't set aside " "these two kind of CPUs for this purpose; " "configure both '[compute] cpu_shared_set' and " "'[compute] cpu_dedicated_set'") raise exception.InvalidConfiguration(msg)

commit_message:
Importing keyrings from files rather than from mons

This change permits users to specify a directory where the keyrings are
located.
It is useful when openstack-ansible have no ssh access to the ceph
cluster.

Change-Id: I6693a7f9d0bc7fe1e20eee53a96de8df8985e148
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ceph_client refs/changes/62/671762/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Path to local keyrings directory # Leave this variable (ceph_keyrings_dir) empty to obtain keyrings from the monitors defined in ceph_mons # If you want to provide keyrings from existing files, because you do not have ssh access to the monitors # set the path to the repository containing the keyrings files. # ie : ceph_keyrings_dir: /etc/openstack_deploy/ceph-conf # The files names inside the keyring directory must look like client-name.keyring. # ie: /etc/openstack_deploy/ceph-conf # cinder.keyring # glance.keyring # etc.. ceph_keyrings_dir: ""

commit_message:
Remove 'InstanceNUMACell.cpu_pinning_requested' field

The 'InstanceNUMACell.cpu_pinning_requested' is 'True' if cpu_policy
is 'dedicated', it is also ensured that all NUMA cells have only CPU
allocation policy, so all 'cpu_pinning_requested' fields within one
instance have the same value. And we also have a property in
'InstanceNUMATopology' object with the same name and in the same
value. So duplication exists among these properties, remove
the property in 'InstanceNUMACell' to resolve it.

Change-Id: Ia5aaaf38499da918d0d8cfda1b61e2a7c5bb6666

commit_message:
Refactor the code in checking available host CPUs

In '_numa_fit_instance_cell', the availability of host
dedicated and shared CPUs are checked to ensure host
has enough dedicated CPUs, probably listing in `[compute].'
'cpu_dedicated_set', for instance CPUs requesting a
pinning and the emulator thread if its allocation
policy is 'ISOLATE', and to ensure the host has enough
shared CPUs, probably listing in `[compute].cpu_shared_set`,
for instance sharing CPUs.

For instance taking `dedicated` policy or `shared` CPU
allocation policy, it is only necessary to check the
availability of either dedicated CPUs or shared CPUs.
While for an instance in `mixed` policy will request
both types of CPUs, this patch refactor this part of code
and checks if host satisfies the request of both type
CPUs.

Change-Id: I1715fc99df3c747312dad1e980a1211427f0fa52

commit_message:
'cpu_pinning_requested' property could be derived directly from cpu_policy

'cpu_pinning_requested' property could be derived from the
'dedicated' cpu_policy. No need to mock the 'cpu_pininng_requested'
and return with 'True' intentionally.

Change-Id: Ide92f4b8e646585c562a7808fe261ec2761c8dd7

subject: Take the instance dedicated CPU list from 'cpu_pinning' if possible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-17 00:55:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3d5c26c101dd1dacdd486217614b80af534ff454', 'message': "scheduler: Introduce 'dedicated' and 'sharing' CPUs for InstanceNUMACell

After the final host chosen decision made by nova-scheduler, the
'InstanceNUMACell.cpu_pinning' field contains the information of
which instance CPU is pinned on which host CPU. And the scheduler
looks for the instance CPU requeeting a pinning from the
'InstanceNUMACell.cpuset' field considering the fact that all
instance CPUs are 'dedicated'(or pinning) CPUs for a instance
take a CPU allocation pollicy other than 'SHARED'.

Here we want scheduler firstly checks the 'cpu_pinning' field,
and looks for the CPUs for pinning from its key if the fileld
is not none. This supports to let part of instance CPUs to be
'dedicated' ones, and the remaining instance CPUs being 'shared'
ones, which will use host CPUs sharing with other instances.g

Change-Id: I385e78bcd07eb3f4c311bc942b6a04ff8007f6a5
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-03-24 14:30:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c008a83358e0fcb08a8d38e79d4df9fa93d32aac', 'message': "Take the instance dedicated CPU list from 'cpu_pinning' if possible

This patch aims to extend the usage of 'InstanceNUMACell.cpu_pinning'
field to keep the instance NUMA cell dedicated CPU list at the
'InstanceNUMACell' object initializing stage. Thus we could create
an instance with partial CPUs being the dedicated CPUs and the rest
being the shared CPUs, which will be introduced as the 'mixed'
instance CPU allocation policy in the following patches.

The 'cpu_pinning' is a dictionary type object, after the
nova-scheduler finally determined the host CPUs that the instance
threads will work on, each item of this dictionary contains an
instance CPU ID and host CPU ID, with the instance CPU ID in the
key, and host CPU ID in value. But the host CPU ID is unknown
before the nova-scheduler involves, for this case, a value '-1'
in the host CPU ID field will be used in later patches, which
means the host CPU for the instance's dedicated CPU is not
determined.

For instance with existing 'dedicated' or 'shared' CPU allocation
policy, the 'cpu_pinning' field will not be used. And all instance
CPUs are dedicated CPUs if CPU allocation policy is 'dedicated',
these rules are not changed.

Change-Id: I385e78bcd07eb3f4c311bc942b6a04ff8007f6a5

commit_message:
Take the instance dedicated CPU list from 'cpu_pinning' if possible

This patch aims to extend the usage of 'InstanceNUMACell.cpu_pinning'
field to keep the instance NUMA cell dedicated CPU list at the
'InstanceNUMACell' object initializing stage. Thus we could create
an instance with partial CPUs being the dedicated CPUs and the rest
being the shared CPUs, which will be introduced as the 'mixed'
instance CPU allocation policy in the following patches.

The 'cpu_pinning' is a dictionary type object, after the
nova-scheduler finally determined the host CPUs that the instance
threads will work on, each item of this dictionary contains an
instance CPU ID and host CPU ID, with the instance CPU ID in the
key, and host CPU ID in value. But the host CPU ID is unknown
before the nova-scheduler involves, for this case, a value '-1'
in the host CPU ID field will be used in later patches, which
means the host CPU for the instance's dedicated CPU is not
determined.

For instance with existing 'dedicated' or 'shared' CPU allocation
policy, the 'cpu_pinning' field will not be used. And all instance
CPUs are dedicated CPUs if CPU allocation policy is 'dedicated',
these rules are not changed.

Change-Id: I385e78bcd07eb3f4c311bc942b6a04ff8007f6a5

self.assertIsInstance(cfg.cputune.emulatorpin, vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestCPUTuneEmulatorPin) self.assertEqual(set([7]), cfg.cputune.emulatorpin.cpuset) for i, (instance_cell, numa_cfg_cell) in enumerate(zip( instance_topology.cells, cfg.cpu.numa.cells)): self.assertEqual(i, numa_cfg_cell.id) self.assertEqual(instance_cell.cpuset, numa_cfg_cell.cpus) self.assertEqual(instance_cell.memory * units.Ki, numa_cfg_cell.memory) self.assertIsNone(numa_cfg_cell.memAccess) allnodes = set([cell.id for cell in instance_topology.cells]) self.assertEqual(allnodes, set(cfg.numatune.memory.nodeset)) self.assertEqual("strict", cfg.numatune.memory.mode) for i, (instance_cell, memnode) in enumerate(zip( instance_topology.cells, cfg.numatune.memnodes)): self.assertEqual(i, memnode.cellid) self.assertEqual([instance_cell.id], memnode.nodeset) def test_get_guest_config_numa_host_instance_cpu_mixed_realtime(self): self.flags(cpu_shared_set='2-5,8-29', cpu_dedicated_set='6,7,30,31', group='compute') instance_topology = objects.InstanceNUMATopology( cells=[ objects.InstanceNUMACell( id=0, cpuset=set([0, 1, 2]), cpu_pinning={0: 6, 1: 7}, memory=1024, pagesize=2048), objects.InstanceNUMACell( id=3, cpuset=set([3, 4, 5]), cpu_pinning={4: 30, 5: 31}, memory=1024, pagesize=2048)]) instance_ref = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) instance_ref.numa_topology = instance_topology image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict(self.test_image_meta) flavor = objects.Flavor(memory_mb=2048, vcpus=6, root_gb=496, ephemeral_gb=8128, swap=33550336, name='fake', extra_specs={ "hw:numa_nodes": "2", "hw:cpu_realtime": "yes", "hw:cpu_policy": "dedicated", "hw:cpu_realtime_mask": "^0-3" }) instance_ref.flavor = flavor caps = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCaps() caps.host cpu_cores=4, cpu_threads=2) for i, cell in enumerate(caps.host.topology.cells): cell.mempages = fakelibvirt.create_mempages( [(4, 1024 * i), (2048, i)]) drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) disk_info = blockinfo.get_disk_info(CONF.libvirt.virt_type, instance_ref, image_meta) with test.nested( mock.patch.object( objects.InstanceNUMATopology, "get_by_instance_uuid", return_value=instance_topology), mock.patch.object(host.Host, 'has_min_version', return_value=True), mock.patch.object(host.Host, commit_message:
Install python3-memcached in CentOS8 and Fedora

... because these now depend on python3, so all python libraries are
nameds as python3-*.

commit_message:
Rescan after restarting the md device

If an md device is restarted, there is a chance, depending
on the OS, that the partition may not be found upon start
of the md device.

Instead, we should always rescan after re-assembling the raid
device.

Story: 2007275
Task: 38712
Change-Id: I92bac20812940e04381a54ef2905ef5f6e293813

commit_message:
Better deduplicate hosts entries created for VIPs

VIPs in /etc/hosts resolve to FQDN only, while other entries are also added
with its shortnames. This makes deduplication of entries inefficient:

$ openstack stack output show standalone HostsEntry -f json

"output_value": [
    "192.168.24.1 standalone.localdomain standalone",
    "192.168.24.1 standalone.ctlplane.localdomain standalone.ctlplane",
    "192.168.24.1  standalone.ctlplane.localdomain" # <-- not good!
]

Add shortnames for VIPs so that it also can be deduped from /etc/hosts

Change-Id: Id9b0ccfacc2666709d3a221b63fcf16fa1c0ae75
Related-bug: #1869375
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[opensuse]Add configuration for trusts enablement

This patch adds some configuration needed when trusts are enabled and
also enables the external loadbalancer configuration when it is enabled.

Change-Id: Id54e8be8194b9a63f51ad69dd32f8592a5de5c00

commit_message:
Automatically assign floating IPs with LBaaS v2

Kubernetes has a feature to automatically assign floating IPs for
load balancers which has been in the codebase since 1.2.0.  This
means that load balancers will automatically get an external
network.

This patch moves the validation and lookup of external network into
a common location so it can be reused, makes Kubernetes base template
detect network names and convert them to IDs for the Heat template
in order to be able to inject it to the Kubernetes cloud configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1714272
Change-Id: I501f111dee72e8a7c076ef436db4172c1f1fdc6a

added_lines: Using Dynamic PVs in Cinder +++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 1. Create a storage class using "cinder" as the provisioner kind: StorageClass apiVersion: storage.k8s.io/v1 metadata: name: gold provisioner: kubernetes.io/cinder parameters: availability: nova 2. Based on the storage-class name, add the volumeClaimTemplates parameter volumeClaimTemplates: - metadata: name: <desired_cinder_volume_name> annotations: volume.beta.kubernetes.io/storage-class: "gold" spec: accessModes: [ "ReadWriteOnce" ] resources: requests: storage: 9Gi "volumeClaimTemplates" parameter can only be used with 'kind: statefulSet' Scaling the statefulSet manually will create a persistent volume in cinder Manual change of the reclaim policy of a dynamically created persistentVolumeClaim kubectl patch pv <pv-name> -p '{"spec":{"persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy":"Retain"}}'

commit_message:
detailed guide how to upgrade magnum ocata to magnum pike  using openstack-ansible

Change-Id: I41fb18a1325d32e7c413f6f1c88cd63131052bd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/02/499802/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================================== MAGNUM OCATA TO MAGNUM PIKE UPGRADE GUIDE =========================================== This guide is intended for users who use Magnum to deploy and manage clusters of hosts for a Container Orchestration Engine. Upgrade openstack ocata to latest stable branch with a minor upgrade ==================================================================== Follow the detailed instructions here: https://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ansible/ocata/upgrade-guide/minor-upgrade.html Check your openstack cluster for errors ======================================= All playbooks must have completed with no errors Edit the user_variables.yaml ============================ You need to declare the magnum_git_repo and magnum_git_install_branch. Openstack-ansible roles have specific releases so all roles can work together with no problems. A work around for this is to tell openstack-ansible to ignore this just for magum pike , and to build magnum with independed dependancies, meaning outside of the openstack global requirements. The user_variables.yaml will look like so: ... ## Debug and Verbose options. debug: false neutron_plugin_base: - router - metering - neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPluginv2 - dns neutron_dns_domain: "openstacklocal." magnum_git_repo: "https://git.openstack.org/openstack/magnum" magnum_git_install_branch: stable/pike magnum_git_install_fragments: "venvwithindex=True&ignorerequirements=True" ... Run the openstack-playbooks =========================== You now have to rerun the repo-install.yaml and os-magnum-install.yaml from within the /opt/openstack-ansible/playbooks directory

commit_message:
Enable HPA featrue with heapster for kubernetes cluster

With --horizontal-pod-autoscaler-use-rest-clients=true HPA uses
new resource metrics API instead of getting heapster metrics.
If we want to use the metrics from heapster, it should be false(
default to true).
Related to: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/57673

Change-Id: I9488fe1b8cdf879e6f274cbdf6553a0617ebd8e9

commit_message:
Increase the maxdepth of index

Project guides should render the second title, not just the first
title on the index page. Let's set the maxdepth to 2. It will make
our index showing more details of kinds of magnum guides.

Change-Id: I14d66fbfcc2d19a0ef446bffd4fa7ac1048eb709

commit_message:
Remove help message about ZeroMQ driver

ZeroMQ driver is deprecated, as per the Dublin 2018 PTG decision:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128055.html

Change-Id: I3e14be95aa64777dcb4ba33dca15280db2a54ba5

commit_message:
service init or heartbeat without hostname

If conf.host is None, use socket.gethostname() as service host
when magnum-service init or heartbeat.

Change-Id: Ib6de03edbdcf6a17af95e2123f51e1f84b9b0c01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/19/594119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import socket self.host = conf.host or socket.gethostname()

subject: Specify storage driver in /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-25 08:26:41.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/fragments/configure_docker_storage_driver_atomic.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/1b431ed3373b092c996b87b25f1ad36a74a4b72a', 'message': 'Specify storage driver in /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage

Magnum should specify the storage driver in /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage
before running docker-storage-setup.
Currently we just specify generic docker storage driver(like overlay),
but forget "devicemapper".

commit_message:
Specify storage driver in /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage

Magnum should specify the storage driver in /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage
before running docker-storage-setup.
Currently we just specify generic docker storage driver(like overlay),
but forget "devicemapper".

Change-Id: I0eee1b568060d0153971575509d27123997a1949
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/02/605002/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Specify the storage driver configured in /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage echo "DOCKER_STORAGE_OPTIONS=\"--storage-driver devicemapper\"" > /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage

on a cluster delete

added_lines: #!/bin/sh . /etc/sysconfig/heat-params CERT_DIR=/etc/kubernetes/certs # Validate if the communication node <-> master is secure or insecure PROTOCOL="https" if [ "$TLS_DISABLED" = "True" ]; then PROTOCOL="http" else OPTIONS=" --cacert ${CERT_DIR}/ca.crt \ --cert ${CERT_DIR}/kubelet.crt \ --key ${CERT_DIR}/kubelet.key " fi if [[ "$VERIFY_CA" = "False" ]]; then OPTIONS+=" -k " fi # Self Patch to trigger usage of dynamic kubelet configuration #CERT_DIR=/etc/kubernetes/certs echo "Patching self to trigger dynamic kubelet configuration" #until curl -sf\ until curl -vv ${OPTIONS}\ --request PATCH --cacert ${CERT_DIR}/ca.crt \ --cert ${CERT_DIR}/kubelet.crt --key ${CERT_DIR}/kubelet.key \ -H 'Content-Type: application/strategic-merge-patch+json' \ -H 'Accept: application/json' --http1.1\ --data '{ "spec": { "configSource": { "configMap": { "name": "kubelet", "namespace": "kube-system", "kubeletConfigKey": "kubelet" } } } }' \ ${PROTOCOL}://${KUBE_MASTER_IP}:${KUBE_API_PORT}/api/v1/nodes/{`hostname | sed 's/.novalocal//'`} do echo "Waiting for kubernedes dynamic kubelet node patch..." sleep 5 done

commit_message:
Do not scope to OS-TRUST when no TRUST_ID is given

When cluster_user_trust is False no TRUST_ID is set causing an invalid
request to be sent to keystone. If no TRUST_ID is given it is sufficient
to authenticate with just the user/password if magnum is configured
with a project_domain_name and user_domain_name.

Change-Id: Ieb1e42d0f8c16eaed276e57e05833c624573ac7c

commit_message:
Add k8s_centos_ironic_v1 driver

Currently, k8s cluster created by Magnum supports Fedora and
CoreOS as guest OS for Master and Minion nodes.
This commit enables support for CentOS as guest OS for Master and
Minion nodes to deploy k8s cluster through magnum.

Change-Id: I031efebf1f9c152919bcbadea95ba3a447be7638
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/44/464544/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2014-10-16 description: > This is a nested stack that defines software configs for Kubernetes minions. parameters: kube_allow_priv: type: string description: > whether or not kubernetes should permit privileged containers. constraints: - allowed_values: ["true", "false"] docker_volume_size: type: number description: > size of a cinder volume to allocate to docker for container/image storage docker_storage_driver: type: string description: docker storage driver name default: "devicemapper" constraints: - allowed_values: ["devicemapper", "overlay"] tls_disabled: type: boolean description: whether or not to enable TLS kubernetes_port: type: number description: > The port which are used by kube-apiserver to provide Kubernetes service. cluster_uuid: type: string description: identifier for the cluster this template is generating magnum_url: type: string description: endpoint to retrieve TLS certs from kube_master_ip: type: string description: IP address of the Kubernetes master server. etcd_server_ip: type: string description: IP address of the Etcd server. network_driver: type: string description: network driver to use for instantiating container networks registry_enabled: type: boolean description: > Indicates whether the docker registry is enabled. registry_port: type: number description: port of registry service swift_region: type: string description: region of swift service registry_container: type: string description: > name of swift container which docker registry stores images in registry_insecure: type: boolean description: > indicates whether to skip TLS verification between registry and backend storage registry_chunksize: type: number description: > size fo the data segments for the swift dynamic large objects volume_driver: type: string description: volume driver to use for container storage region_name: type: string description: A logically separate section of the cluster tenant_name: type: string description: an alternative term for a project username: type: string description: > user account password: type: string description: > user password, not set in current implementation, only used to fill in for Kubernetes config file hidden: true http_proxy: type: string description: http proxy address for docker https_proxy: type: string description: https proxy address for docker no_proxy: type: string description: no proxies for docker kube_version: type: string description: version of kubernetes used for kubernetes cluster trustee_domain_id: type: string description: domain id of the trustee trustee_user_id: type: string description: user id of the trustee trustee_username: type: string description: username of the trustee trustee_password: type: string description: password of the trustee hidden: true trust_id: type: string description: id of the trust which is used by the trustee hidden: true auth_url: type: string description: > url for keystone, must be v2 since k8s backend only support v2 at this point insecure_registry_url: type: string description: insecure registry url wc_curl_cli: type: string description : > Wait condition notify command for Minion. resources: ###################################################################### # # software configs. these are components that are combined into # a multipart MIME user-data archive. # write_heat_params: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: str_replace: template: {get_file: ../../common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/write-heat-params.yaml} params: $KUBE_ALLOW_PRIV: {get_param: kube_allow_priv} $KUBE_MASTER_IP: {get_param: kube_master_ip} $KUBE_API_PORT: {get_param: kubernetes_port} $ETCD_SERVER_IP: {get_param: etcd_server_ip} $DOCKER_VOLUME: 'None' $DOCKER_VOLUME_SIZE: {get_param: docker_volume_size} $DOCKER_STORAGE_DRIVER: {get_param: docker_storage_driver} $NETWORK_DRIVER: {get_param: network_driver} $REGISTRY_ENABLED: {get_param: registry_enabled} $REGISTRY_PORT: {get_param: registry_port} $SWIFT_REGION: {get_param: swift_region} $REGISTRY_CONTAINER: {get_param: registry_container} $REGISTRY_INSECURE: {get_param: registry_insecure} $REGISTRY_CHUNKSIZE: {get_param: registry_chunksize} $TLS_DISABLED: {get_param: tls_disabled} $CLUSTER_UUID: {get_param: cluster_uuid} $MAGNUM_URL: {get_param: magnum_url} $USERNAME: {get_param: username} $PASSWORD: {get_param: password} $VOLUME_DRIVER: {get_param: volume_driver} $REGION_NAME: {get_param: region_name} $TENANT_NAME: {get_param: tenant_name} $HTTP_PROXY: {get_param: http_proxy} $HTTPS_PROXY: {get_param: https_proxy} $NO_PROXY: {get_param: no_proxy} $KUBE_VERSION: {get_param: kube_version} $WAIT_CURL: {get_param: wc_curl_cli} $TRUSTEE_DOMAIN_ID: {get_param: trustee_domain_id} $TRUSTEE_USER_ID: {get_param: trustee_user_id} $TRUSTEE_USERNAME: {get_param: trustee_username} $TRUSTEE_PASSWORD: {get_param: trustee_password} $TRUST_ID: {get_param: trust_id} $AUTH_URL: {get_param: auth_url} $INSECURE_REGISTRY_URL: {get_param: insecure_registry_url} $ENABLE_CINDER: "False" write_kubeconfig: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: {get_file: ../../common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/write-kubeconfig.yaml} make_cert: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: {get_file: ../../common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/make-cert-client.sh} configure_docker_storage: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: str_replace: params: $configure_docker_storage_driver: {get_file: ../../common/templates/fragments/configure_docker_storage_driver_atomic.sh} template: {get_file: ../../common/templates/fragments/configure-docker-storage.sh} configure_docker_registry: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: {get_file: ../../common/templates/fragments/configure-docker-registry.sh} configure_kubernetes_minion: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: {get_file: ../../common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-minion.sh} kube_examples: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: {get_file: ../../common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/kube-examples.yaml} network_service: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: {get_file: ../../common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/network-service.sh} enable_services: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: {get_file: ../../common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/enable-services-minion.sh} enable_docker_registry: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: {get_file: commit_message:
kubernetes: add retry logic for atomic installs

It is possible that during the deployment, DockerHub fails for
some reason and the installation stalls out.  This adds a retry
login which will retry for 5 times with a 15 second timeout before
failing.

Story: #2002589
Task: #28337
Change-Id: Ide503850755b2e1bd80cd1c028b7fcaf89f62a5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/67/623567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mnaser): This is a function that attempts to do an Atomic install with # retries to workaround any network problems. function atomic_install { local name=$1 local image=$2 local flags=$3 for i in {1..5}; do atomic install --storage ostree --system $flags --system-package=no --name=$name $image && break || sleep 15 done } atomic_install "kubelet" "${_prefix}kubernetes-kubelet:${KUBE_TAG}" "--set=ADDTL_MOUNTS=${_addtl_mounts}" atomic_install "kube-apiserver" "${_prefix}kubernetes-apiserver:${KUBE_TAG}" atomic_install "kube-controller-manager" "${_prefix}kubernetes-controller-manager:${KUBE_TAG}" atomic_install "kube-scheduler" "${_prefix}kubernetes-scheduler:${KUBE_TAG}" atomic_install "kube-proxy" "${_prefix}kubernetes-proxy:${KUBE_TAG}"
deleted_lines: atomic install --storage ostree --system --set=ADDTL_MOUNTS=${_addtl_mounts} --system-package=no --name=kubelet ${_prefix}kubernetes-kubelet:${KUBE_TAG} atomic install --storage ostree --system --system-package=no --name=kube-apiserver ${_prefix}kubernetes-apiserver:${KUBE_TAG} atomic install --storage ostree --system --system-package=no --name=kube-controller-manager ${_prefix}kubernetes-controller-manager:${KUBE_TAG} atomic install --storage ostree --system --system-package=no --name=kube-scheduler ${_prefix}kubernetes-scheduler:${KUBE_TAG} atomic install --storage ostree --system --system-package=no --name=kube-proxy ${_prefix}kubernetes-proxy:${KUBE_TAG}

commit_message:
Correct path of environment file for flannel-docker-bridge service

Environment file for flannel-docker-bridge service should be
/run/flannel/subnet.env, not /run/flanneld/subnet.env.

Change-Id: I6e00ad55bcde3035f2de1ad1486db51fff6ebcfb

commit_message:
Correct configurations for kubelet and kube-proxy

There are a few of wrong configurations for kubelet and kube-proxy
when TLS is disabled:
1. In file kubelet-config.yaml, line "user:" should not be deleted.
2. In file proxy-config.yaml, "client-certificate", "client-key",
    "certificate-authority" should be deleted.
3. In file /etc/kubernetes/kubelet, options "--client-ca-file",
    "--tls-cert-file", "--tls-private-key-file" should be deleted.

Change-Id: Id71909b971dddd36ec758975a381454eec5ef943
Closes-bug: #1792663
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/83/602283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sed -i 's/^.*client-certificate.*$//' ${PROXY_KUBECONFIG} sed -i 's/^.*client-key.*$//' ${PROXY_KUBECONFIG} sed -i 's/^.*certificate-authority.*$//' ${PROXY_KUBECONFIG}if [ "$TLS_DISABLED" = "False" ]; then KUBELET_ARGS="${KUBELET_ARGS} --client-ca-file=${CERT_DIR}/ca.crt --tls-cert-file=${CERT_DIR}/kubelet.crt --tls-private-key-file=${CERT_DIR}/kubelet.key" fi

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove deprecated services

Services marked for deprecation:
* Heapster
* Influx
* Grafana
* Dashboard

With the installation of the new monitoring solution
the previous influx-grafana deployment based on heapster
is no longer needed. This patch tracks the deletion of
the unneeded services that are replaced by this chart
but that are kept to allow for backward compatibility.

Story: 2004623
depends_on: I80d590785bf30f9d634debeaf51c0d4cce0aeb93
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib5161e6674bb0d12aa461eeb924d436d37b4826d

commit_message:
change order of  enable_services

In kubemaster.yml[1] file services are enabled and started before network
config, so it should be after network config. Order of enable services is
updated.
[1]https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/ \
k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/kubemaster.yaml

Change-Id: I420b2da2aaa9bb5dc45b896a4cd846d84374d4b4

(cherry picked from commit eb896946931c8d825af362b558c8b53bcc1e5800)

formatted as quotations.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/66/587366/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This is the initial version of the v1.1 API which supports microversions. The v1.1 API is from the REST API users's point of view exactly the same as v1.0 except with strong input validation. A user can specify a header in the API request::where ``<version>`` is any valid api version for this API. If no version is specified then the API will behave as if a version request of v1.1 was requested.Support for async cluster (previously known as bay) operations Before v1.2 all magnum bay operations were synchronous and as a result API requests were blocked until response from HEAT service is received. With this change cluster-create/bay-create, cluster-update/bay-update and cluster-delete/bay-delete calls will be asynchronous.Rollback cluster (previously known as bay) on update failure User can enable rollback on bay update failure by specifying microversion 1.3 in header({'OpenStack-API-Version': 'container-infra 1.3'}) and passing 'rollback=True' when issuing cluster/bay update request. For example:Add stats API An admin user can get total number of clusters and nodes for a specified tenant or for all the tenants and also a non-admin user can get self stats. For example:Support for cluster CA certificate rotation This gives admins a way to revoke access to an existing cluster once a user has been granted access.Add quotas API An admin user can set/update/delete/list quotas for the given tenant. A non-admin user can get self quota information.
deleted_lines: This is the initial version of the v1.1 API which supports microversions. The v1.1 API is from the REST API users's point of view exactly the same as v1.0 except with strong input validation. A user can specify a header in the API request:: where ``<version>`` is any valid api version for this API. If no version is specified then the API will behave as if a version request of v1.1 was requested. Support for async cluster (previously known as bay) operations Before v1.2 all magnum bay operations were synchronous and as a result API requests were blocked until response from HEAT service is received. With this change cluster-create/bay-create, cluster-update/bay-update and cluster-delete/bay-delete calls will be asynchronous. Rollback cluster (previously known as bay) on update failure User can enable rollback on bay update failure by specifying microversion 1.3 in header({'OpenStack-API-Version': 'container-infra 1.3'}) and passing 'rollback=True' when issuing cluster/bay update request. For example:- Add stats API An admin user can get total number of clusters and nodes for a specified tenant or for all the tenants and also a non-admin user can get self stats. For example:- Support for cluster CA certificate rotation This gives admins a way to revoke access to an existing cluster once a user has been granted access. Add quotas API An admin user can set/update/delete/list quotas for the given tenant. A non-admin user can get self quota information.

revisions:

commit_message:
[k8s] Install Kubernetes dashboard with helm

Following our development on the use of helm, let's install kubernetes cluster dashboard using the upstream chart stable/kubernetes-dashboard

Currently the CPU/Memory metrics are not available with the metrics-server.
A PR is on the way to fix this issue, and there is already available a fix for preview.
Check> https://github.com/kubernetes/dashboard/pull/3504

Change-Id: Ic7f1a3922acb065e94959148679f3098d43cb773
Story: 2004816
Task: 29603
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/71/638371/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -ex step="kubernetes-dashboard" printf "Starting to run ${step}\n" . /etc/sysconfig/heat-params ### Configuration ############################################################################### CHART_NAME="kubernetes-dashboard" CHART_VERSION="1.2.0" if [ "$(echo ${KUBE_DASHBOARD_ENABLED} | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')" = "true" ]; then # Validate if communication node <-> master is secure or insecure PROTOCOL="https" INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY="False" if [ "$TLS_DISABLED" = "True" ]; then PROTOCOL="http" INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY="True" fi if [ "$(echo ${VERIFY_CA} | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')" == "false" ]; then INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY="True" fi HELM_MODULE_CONFIG_FILE="/srv/magnum/kubernetes/helm/${CHART_NAME}.yaml" [ -f ${HELM_MODULE_CONFIG_FILE} ] || { echo "Writing File: ${HELM_MODULE_CONFIG_FILE}" mkdir -p $(dirname ${HELM_MODULE_CONFIG_FILE}) cat << EOF > ${HELM_MODULE_CONFIG_FILE} --- kind: ConfigMap apiVersion: v1 metadata: name: ${CHART_NAME}-config namespace: magnum-tiller labels: app: helm data: install-${CHART_NAME}.sh: | #!/bin/bash set -e set -x mkdir -p \${HELM_HOME} cp /etc/helm/* \${HELM_HOME} # HACK - Force wait because of bug https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/5170 until helm init --client-only --wait do sleep 5s done helm repo update if [[ \$(helm history kubernetes-dashboard | grep kubernetes-dashboard) ]]; then echo "${CHART_NAME} already installed on server. Continue..." exit 0 else helm install stable/${CHART_NAME} --namespace kube-system --name ${CHART_NAME} --version v${CHART_VERSION} --values /opt/magnum/install-${CHART_NAME}-values.yaml fi install-${CHART_NAME}-values.yaml: | fullnameOverride: kubernetes-dashboard image: repository: ${CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX:-k8s.gcr.io/}kubernetes-dashboard-amd64 enableInsecureLogin: ${INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY} --- apiVersion: batch/v1 kind: Job metadata: name: install-${CHART_NAME}-job namespace: magnum-tiller spec: backoffLimit: 5 template: spec: serviceAccountName: tiller containers: - name: config-helm image: docker.io/openstackmagnum/helm-client:dev command: - bash args: - /opt/magnum/install-${CHART_NAME}.sh env: - name: HELM_HOME value: /helm_home - name: TILLER_NAMESPACE value: magnum-tiller - name: HELM_TLS_ENABLE value: "true" volumeMounts: - name: install-${CHART_NAME}-config mountPath: /opt/magnum/ - mountPath: /etc/helm name: helm-client-certs restartPolicy: Never volumes: - name: install-${CHART_NAME}-config configMap: name: ${CHART_NAME}-config - name: helm-client-certs secret: secretName: helm-client-secret EOF } fi printf "Finished running ${step}\n"

commit_message:
Introduce driver-specific cluster labels

Today cluster labels list is hardcoded for all drivers
even a driver doesn't have some values which are specific
for a different driver.
To avoid 'The parameter (___) was not defined in template'
exception drivers list is no longer hardcoded and it is
split into two parts: first one is common lables and second
one is driver-specific labels. Those parts can be redefined
for a specific driver.

Change-Id: Iee69d4a1efa0596a6a3d70eb5a4eaf40e9ba96b4
Closes-Bug: #1764700
Related-Bug: #1722523

commit_message:
change order of  enable_services

config, so it should be after network config. Order of enable services is
updated.

k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/kubemaster.yaml

commit_message:
Add OVN as a CNI network backend for k8s

OVN is a project that provides virtual networking through Open vSwitch.
This allows to use ovn-kubernetes as a CNI plugin for the k8s fedora driver.

Change-Id: Ie6b9bf64222399de26707882982bdf8a3b0e8ba0
Task: 30982
Story: 2005671
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/96/658996/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh . /etc/sysconfig/heat-params set -x # Local hostname resolution necessary for ovn components if [ "$NETWORK_DRIVER" = "ovn" ]; then hostname=$(hostname) hostnameless=${hostname%".novalocal"} default_iface=$(ip r | grep default | sed -e "s/^.*dev.//" -e "s/.proto.*//") localip=$(ip a s ${default_iface} | grep 'inet ' | awk '{print $2}' | awk -F "/" '{print $1}') echo $localip $hostnameless $hostname >> /etc/hosts fi

commit_message:
fix pulling image from insecure registry error

to use image from insecure registry when running `atomic install`,
`/etc/containers/registries.con` need to be configured as follow
```
[registries.insecure]
registries = ['$INSECURE_REGISTRY_URL']
```

Task: 30979
Story: 2005668
Change-Id: I68492bf7511df7f1275bea1ca29f58573661ac6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/68/658968/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh . /etc/sysconfig/heat-params set -x cat > /etc/containers/registries.conf <<EOF [registries.search] registries = ['docker.io', 'registry.fedoraproject.org', 'quay.io', 'registry.access.redhat.com', 'registry.centos.org'] [registries.insecure] registries = ['$INSECURE_REGISTRY_URL'] [registries.block] registries = [] EOF

commit_message:
suport multi discovery service

magnum will try to use discovery url in following order:
1. discovery url which is passed when create a cluster
2. discovery service endpoint in configuration
3. if configurated discovery endpoint is differnent from
   "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" and,
   use "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" as a backup
   service

Task: 26938
Story:2003994

Change-Id: I915b554ad96cf8f256814d8fac614aa3715fc4e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/94/657194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: if hasattr(cluster, 'discovery_url') and cluster.discovery_url: self.validate_discovery_url(cluster.discovery_url, cluster.master_count) discovery_url = cluster.discovery_url else: discovery_endpoint = ( CONF.cluster.etcd_discovery_service_endpoint_format % {'size': cluster.master_count}) else: cluster.discovery_url = discovery_url

subject: Revert "support http/https proxy for discovery url"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-25 08:05:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/1ed574a6ba1b510f2034df66cb2465b901e24140', 'message': 'Revert "support http/https proxy for discovery url"

This reverts commit 2ba0cbce4182923fa58db087fb946c83fc7fa5b9.

This commit is reverted for two reasons:

* It is undesirable that the end user can inject proxy config into
  the magnum-conductor service via the cluster template.

* The proxy settings for the magnum-conductor service may not be
  the same as those which are required in the cluster template for
  the end user VM.

Systemd, docker and podman all include native mechanisms for setting
environment variables for proecesses, and this should be used by the
cloud operator / deployment tooling to configure the required proxy
settings for the magnum-conductor service.

In particular this patch makes it impossible for the cloud operator
to specify their own http_proxy via the environment, the user supplied
cluster template setting will always be used.

Change-Id: I33da19ad6764bedcf15f2a08381063e2471f8991
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-07-05 19:06:12.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/heat/k8s_template_def.py', 'magnum/drivers/heat/template_def.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/drivers/test_template_definition.py', 'magnum/drivers/heat/swarm_fedora_template_def.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_k8s_cluster_conductor.py', 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-etcd.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/ce82b83758f6e0b309c349bff6549d168caad6af', 'message': 'Revert "support http/https proxy for discovery url"

[stable branch policy requiring a backport rather than an 'in branch'
revert means that the following revert SHA refers to the parent patch,
not to this branch]

This reverts commit e8d0ee1b144f4db24367ad48bd2cb4306add6672.

This commit is reverted for two reasons:

* It is undesirable that the end user can inject proxy config into
  the magnum-conductor service via the cluster template.

* The proxy settings for the magnum-conductor service may not be
  the same as those which are required in the cluster template for
  the end user VM.

Systemd, docker and podman all include native mechanisms for setting
environment variables for proecesses, and this should be used by the
cloud operator / deployment tooling to configure the required proxy
settings for the magnum-conductor service.

In particular this patch makes it impossible for the cloud operator
to specify their own http_proxy via the environment, the user supplied
cluster template setting will always be used.

conflicts: magnum/drivers/heat/template_def.py

Change-Id: I33da19ad6764bedcf15f2a08381063e2471f8991
(cherry picked from commit 79699f23cddf906753b02562f6d2aebc03e3e15e)
(cherry picked from commit 1c4f8127f183724fb885662e68d1133899c3336c)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "support http/https proxy for discovery url"

[stable branch policy requiring a backport rather than an 'in branch'
revert means that the following revert SHA refers to the parent patch,
not to this branch]

This reverts commit e8d0ee1b144f4db24367ad48bd2cb4306add6672.

This commit is reverted for two reasons:

* It is undesirable that the end user can inject proxy config into
  the magnum-conductor service via the cluster template.

* The proxy settings for the magnum-conductor service may not be
  the same as those which are required in the cluster template for
  the end user VM.

Systemd, docker and podman all include native mechanisms for setting
environment variables for proecesses, and this should be used by the
cloud operator / deployment tooling to configure the required proxy
settings for the magnum-conductor service.

In particular this patch makes it impossible for the cloud operator
to specify their own http_proxy via the environment, the user supplied
cluster template setting will always be used.

conflicts: magnum/drivers/heat/template_def.py

Change-Id: I33da19ad6764bedcf15f2a08381063e2471f8991
(cherry picked from commit 79699f23cddf906753b02562f6d2aebc03e3e15e)

commit_message:
Fix pep8 issues caused by bandit version 1.6.0

Since the release of bandit 1.6.0 the '-x' option seems to have
changed behavior. Previously, to match a path like 'magnum/tests/*',
you could state '-x test'. This option now expects a glob patterns,
such as '-x magnum/tests/*'.

Change-Id: I274a366f0f87cca96177ccf8f137f9f489f05b60
Story: #2005696
Task: #31017

deleted_lines: bandit -r magnum -x tests -n5 -llcommands = bandit -r magnum -x tests -n5 -ll

commit_message:
Revert "support http/https proxy for discovery url"

[stable branch policy requiring a backport rather than an 'in branch'
revert means that the following revert SHA refers to the parent patch,
not to this branch]

This reverts commit e8d0ee1b144f4db24367ad48bd2cb4306add6672.

This commit is reverted for two reasons:

* It is undesirable that the end user can inject proxy config into
  the magnum-conductor service via the cluster template.

* The proxy settings for the magnum-conductor service may not be
  the same as those which are required in the cluster template for
  the end user VM.

Systemd, docker and podman all include native mechanisms for setting
environment variables for proecesses, and this should be used by the
cloud operator / deployment tooling to configure the required proxy
settings for the magnum-conductor service.

In particular this patch makes it impossible for the cloud operator
to specify their own http_proxy via the environment, the user supplied
cluster template setting will always be used.

conflicts: magnum/drivers/heat/template_def.py

commit_message:
(wip) federation api: fedora-atomic implementation

Story: 2002288
Task: 22712
Change-Id: I1ba6bf88bf696a1be1c62ea7dbc58cc6ff08ecbb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/07/535007/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging import six from magnum.common import profiler import magnum.conf from magnum.drivers.common import driver from magnum import objects from magnum.objects import fields CONF = magnum.conf.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @profiler.trace_cls("rpc") class Handler(object): def __init__(self): super(Handler, self).__init__() # Federation operations. # Please note they are all performed in the hostcluster. def federation_create(self, context, federation, create_timeout): LOG.debug('federation_heat federation_create') federation.status = fields.FederationStatus.CREATE_IN_PROGRESS federation.status_reason = None federation.create() try: # Get the hostcluster driver. hostcluster = objects.Cluster.get(context, federation.hostcluster_id) host_driver = driver.Driver.get_driver_for_cluster(context, hostcluster) host_driver.create_federation(context, federation, create_timeout) federation.save() # TODO(clenimar): Improve exception handling. except Exception as e: federation.status = fields.FederationStatus.CREATE_FAILED federation.status_reason = six.text_type(e) federation.save() raise return federation def federation_update(self, context, federation, rollback=False): LOG.debug('federation_heat federation_update') delta = federation.obj_what_changed() if not delta: return federation try: # Get the hostcluster driver. hostcluster = objects.Cluster.get(context, federation.hostcluster_id) host_driver = driver.Driver.get_driver_for_cluster(context, hostcluster) # Perform the update. host_driver.update_federation(context, federation, rollback) federation.status = fields.FederationStatus.UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS federation.status_reason = None # TODO(clenimar): Improve exception handling. except Exception as e: federation.status = fields.FederationStatus.UPDATE_FAILED federation.status_reason = six.text_type(e) federation.save() raise federation.save() return federation def federation_delete(self, context, uuid): LOG.debug('federation_conductor federation_delete') federation = objects.Federation.get(context, uuid) try: # Get the hostcluster driver. hostcluster = objects.Cluster.get(context, federation.hostcluster_id) host_driver = driver.Driver.get_driver_for_cluster(context, hostcluster) # Delete the federation. host_driver.delete_federation(context, federation) federation.status = fields.FederationStatus.DELETE_IN_PROGRESS federation.status_reason = None # TODO(clenimar): Improve exception handling. except Exception as e: federation.status = fields.FederationStatus.DELETE_FAILED federation.status_reason = six.text_type(e) federation.save() raise federation.save() return None

added_lines: replace_certs_param: type: string default: '' description: > Supplying a new value to this parameter during a stack update will cause the software deployment resources that replace the SSL certificates to run. user_data_format: SOFTWARE_CONFIG software_config_transport: POLL_SERVER_HEAT replace_certs: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: script config: {get_file: fragments/make-cert.sh} replace_certs_deployment: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment properties: signal_transport: HEAT_SIGNAL config: {get_resource: replace_certs} server: {get_resource: kube_master} actions: ['UPDATE'] input_values: replace_certs_param: {get_param: replace_certs_param} restart_apiserver: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: script config: | #!/bin/sh cd /srv/kubernetes/ /bin/cp ca.crt server.crt server.key /etc/kubernetes/pki/ pkill -9 kube-apiserver sleep 1 # the kube-apiserver pod will respawn, wait for this to happen # before exiting and letting cluster be marked UPDATE COMPLETE while ! pgrep kube-apiserver; do sleep 1 done restart_apiserver_deployment: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment depends_on: replace_certs_deployment properties: signal_transport: HEAT_SIGNAL config: {get_resource: restart_apiserver} server: {get_resource: kube_master} actions: ['UPDATE'] input_values: replace_certs_param: {get_param: replace_certs_param}

commit_message:
[WIP] Add UT framework for DB migrations

This change introduces a new UT framework to test data migrations
between database revisions.

Change-Id: I66716288205389ff1d40e8532f618f7c6be8fb23

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new magnum-functional-api-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

Magnum has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6' and
'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification
script via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'magnum-functional-api-ipv6-only'
run on gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35902

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I3b9e88a6993a16143cfdbf8499389fca12d4af29

'"disable_service ceilometer-acompute" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'

'"disable_service ceilometer-api" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"disable_service ceilometer-collector" fi # Keep localrc to be able to set some vars in post_test_hook export KEEP_LOCALRC=1 function gate_hook { cd /opt/stack/new/magnum/ ./magnum/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh {{ coe }} $MAGNUM_GATE_SPECIAL } export -f gate_hook function post_test_hook { source $BASE/new/devstack/accrc/admin/admin cd /opt/stack/new/magnum/ ./magnum/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh {{ coe }} $MAGNUM_GATE_SPECIAL cd $BASE/new/tempest/tools ./verify-ipv6-only-deployments.sh } export -f post_test_hook cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
k8s: set functional jobs to voting

Since the fixes to resolve functional tests have merged, there
has been 42 runs of magnum-functional-k8s, out of those, only 3
failed and 2 of those failures were actual failures that caught
a breakage, with one being non-deterministic[1].

The job seems stable enough in order to run with voting in order
to make sure that we never merge code that breaks a deployment
of a new Kubernetes cluster.

[1]: http://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=magnum-functional-k8s&branch=master

Change-Id: Ie0b5bc1f2455ec7ecbb68d8042390a92550706d7

commit_message:
Update functional tests documentation

Updated the functional tests documentation to:
- source the configuration/ini functions from devstack
- note that some variables might need to be modified
  depending on each particular installation
- update the current api identity version

Change-Id: I0665781d3b9c1a3263acc29467883ef55e23129d

stack_status_reason='fake_reason_88') self.stack9 = fake_stack( id='99', stack_status=cluster_status.DELETE_COMPLETE, stack_status_reason='fake_reason_99') self.stack10 = fake_stack( id='1010', stack_status=cluster_status.DELETE_FAILED, stack_status_reason='fake_reason_1010') self.stack1, self.stack2, self.stack3, self.stack5, # 6-10 are for failed cluster tests. self.stack6, self.stack7, self.stack8, self.stack9, self.stack10] '55': self.stack5, '66': self.stack6, '77': self.stack7, '88': self.stack8, '99': self.stack9, '1010': self.stack10 def test_sync_failed_cluster_status_changes(self, mock_db_destroy, mock_ng_destroy, mock_cluster_list, mock_get_driver): mock_cluster_list.return_value = [self.cluster6, self.cluster7, self.cluster8, self.cluster9, self.cluster10] mock_get_driver.return_value = self.mock_driver with mock.patch.object(dbapi.Connection, 'list_cluster_nodegroups', mock_nodegroup_list): periodic.MagnumPeriodicTasks(CONF).sync_failed_cluster_status(None) # Previous status: CREATE_FAILED self.assertEqual( cluster_status.DELETE_COMPLETE, self.cluster6.status) self.assertEqual('fake_reason_66', self.cluster6.status_reason) # Previous status: UPDATE_FAILED self.assertEqual( cluster_status.DELETE_COMPLETE, self.cluster7.status) self.assertEqual('fake_reason_77', self.cluster7.status_reason) # Previous status: DELETE_FAILED self.assertEqual( cluster_status.DELETE_COMPLETE, self.cluster8.status) self.assertEqual('fake_reason_88', self.cluster8.status_reason) # Previous status: ROLLBACK_FAILED self.assertEqual( cluster_status.DELETE_COMPLETE, self.cluster9.status) self.assertEqual('fake_reason_99', self.cluster9.status_reason) # Previous status: CREATE_FAILED # Make sure the status will updated if other status shows up self.assertEqual( cluster_status.DELETE_FAILED, self.cluster10.status) self.assertEqual('fake_reason_1010', self.cluster10.status_reason) notifications = fake_notifier.NOTIFICATIONS self.assertEqual(5, len(notifications)) @mock.patch('oslo_service.loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall', new=fakes.FakeLoopingCall) @mock.patch('magnum.drivers.common.driver.Driver.get_driver_for_cluster') @mock.patch('magnum.objects.Cluster.list') @mock.patch.object(dbapi.Connection, 'destroy_nodegroup') @mock.patch.object(dbapi.Connection, 'destroy_cluster')

commit_message:
Remove buildimage jobs

Remove buildimage jobs, they have been disabled in April 2019 and the
project uses upstream images now.

Remove them so that the legacy parent job can be removed, this repo
is one of the final users.

Change-Id: Ieb4fe3e6122270b4e9114012dee5af747d88d539
(cherry picked from commit a4190dc9d0bce4a4d7c7633aacf6e282ac5a5128)

commit_message:
Allow default-worker to have node_count=0

With the arrival of nodegroups, this change allows a cluster's
default-worker group to be resized to 0 so that they can be replaced
with new nodegroups.

story: 2007272
task: 38686

Change-Id: I5c6d9b8f1ad8c9c77eb758f225c32d14ce86cac5
Depends-On: Ie91fdfe71058b45c5fd1217920b8b5b993e47734
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>

commit_message:
Revert "openstack-base: pin setuptools < 46 to get horizon working"

This reverts commit 5498671b344e48d6db865887537ff15cf4028510.

Horizon moved to pyScss2 which works with latest setuptools.

Change-Id: I1577cdc806fee286ef00b9454306850474383dad

commit_message:
Extend install_bootloader command timeout

Adds a new command_timeout_factor argument to the
agent client _command method with a default value of 1,
and sets the install_bootloader command to send a value of 2
to extend the timeout factor to give the agent time to complete
its work before giving up on installing the bootloader and
automatically retrying.

Change-Id: Iab72903c3d30b0ae5b80a5115fc635179869eeee
Story: 2007483
Task: 39201

subject: Add bulk IP address assignment to ipam driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-26 12:30:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/ipam/requests.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/test_driver.py', 'neutron/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bce7b2f5387d623424dbe7ac5b8c887b4f6cb393', 'message': 'Add bulk IP address assignment to ipam driver

Create a method for bulk assignment of IP addresses within the ipam
driver, to support bulk creation of ports.

This also changes the logic for how the window of available IP addresses
to assign from is calculated within the neutrondb IPAM driver.  The
Python random module is used to produce a statistically sampled set of
IP addresses out of the set of available IPs; this will facilitate
collission avoidance.  When requesting multiple IP addresses the
selection window sized is increased significantly to ensure a larger
number of available IPs, but caps are placed on the amount to make sure
we do not transgress system limits when building pools of IPv6
addresses.

Change-Id: Iad8088eaa261b07153fa358ae34b9a2442bc2a3e
Implements: blueprint speed-up-neutron-bulk-creation
(cherry picked from commit 06e38be42e3996eb8c142c657aa80c825e767f6d)
'}]
commit_message:
Add bulk IP address assignment to ipam driver

Create a method for bulk assignment of IP addresses within the ipam
driver, to support bulk creation of ports.

This also changes the logic for how the window of available IP addresses
to assign from is calculated within the neutrondb IPAM driver.  The
Python random module is used to produce a statistically sampled set of
IP addresses out of the set of available IPs; this will facilitate
collission avoidance.  When requesting multiple IP addresses the
selection window sized is increased significantly to ensure a larger
number of available IPs, but caps are placed on the amount to make sure
we do not transgress system limits when building pools of IPv6
addresses.

Change-Id: Iad8088eaa261b07153fa358ae34b9a2442bc2a3e
Implements: blueprint speed-up-neutron-bulk-creation
(cherry picked from commit 06e38be42e3996eb8c142c657aa80c825e767f6d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/87/715187/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MAX_WIN = 1000 MULTIPLIER = 100 MAX_WIN_MULTI = MAX_WIN * MULTIPLIER return self._generate_ips(context, prefer_next)[0] def _generate_ips(self, context, prefer_next=False, num_addresses=1): """Generate a set of IPs from the set of available addresses.""" if av_set.size < num_addresses: # Not enough addresses in pool to perform validation # TODO(njohnston): How to handle when there are enough IPs but # not enough in a single pool to satisfy the request? continue if prefer_next: allocated_ip_pool = list(itertools.islice(av_set, num_addresses)) return [str(allocated_ip) for allocated_ip in allocated_ip_pool] window = min(av_set.size, MAX_WIN) # NOTE(gryf): If there is more than one address, make the window # bigger, so that are chances to fulfill demanded amount of IPs. if num_addresses > 1: window = min(av_set.size, num_addresses * MULTIPLIER, MAX_WIN_MULTI) if window < num_addresses: continue else: # Maximize randomness by using the random module's built in # sampling function av_ips = list(itertools.islice(av_set, 0, window)) allocated_ip_pool = random.sample(av_ips, num_addresses) return [str(allocated_ip) for allocated_ip in allocated_ip_pool] ip_address = self._generate_ip(self._context, prefer_next) def bulk_allocate(self, address_request): # The signature of this function differs from allocate only in that it # returns a list of addresses, as opposed to a single address. if not isinstance(address_request, ipam_req.BulkAddressRequest): return [self.allocate(address_request)] num_addrs = address_request.num_addresses allocated_ip_pool = self._generate_ips(self._context, False, num_addrs) # Create IP allocation request objects try: with self._context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): for ip_address in allocated_ip_pool: self.subnet_manager.create_allocation(self._context, ip_address) except db_exc.DBReferenceError: raise n_exc.SubnetNotFound( subnet_id=self.subnet_manager.neutron_id) return allocated_ip_pool
deleted_lines: if prefer_next: window = 1 else: # Compute a value for the selection window window = min(av_set.size, 30) ip_index = random.randint(1, window) candidate_ips = list(itertools.islice(av_set, ip_index)) allocated_ip = candidate_ips[ random.randint(0, len(candidate_ips) - 1)] return str(allocated_ip), ip_pool.id all_pool_id = None ip_address, all_pool_id = self._generate_ip(self._context, prefer_next)

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 3.0.0

The new version enables a lot of standard flake8 checks, so a few
fixes are required. W503 is disabled as it conflicts with W504
and the latter seems to be preferred nowadays.

Change-Id: I9e576a74400b469198d7faaa012a905b8da3514e

Fix problems found by updated hacking version.

subject: default host to socket.gethostname()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-25 15:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['cyborg/conf/default.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cyborg/commit/ec0eab0ffb4fc18574dbd937f29545832d317e4c', 'message': "default host to socket.gethostname()

As disucssed in november cyborg does not defualt its host
paramater to the same value as nova.
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-November/011044.html

This change updates the default value to match novas.

On a host that does not have a fqdn set via dhcp
and a corresponding dns record getfqdn() and gethostname()
will return differnet values. This can also be seen in the
differece in the hostname command output.

[stack@cyborg-2 ~] hostname
cyborg-2
[stack@cyborg-2 ~] hostname --fqdn
localhost

as a result on a host without an fqdn set in /etc/hostname
or an fqdn set via dhcp/dns using socket.getfqdn() will
result in 'localhost.localdomain' where as socket.gethostname()
will result in 'cyborg-2'

This is required to have the correct default behavior so that
cyborg and discover and the parent placment resouce provider
corresponding to the current host.

Change-Id: I1687043dc2469343878cfeb466703eb9d4099ad0
"}]
commit_message:
default host to socket.gethostname()

As disucssed in november cyborg does not defualt its host
paramater to the same value as nova.
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-November/011044.html

This change updates the default value to match novas.

On a host that does not have a fqdn set via dhcp
and a corresponding dns record getfqdn() and gethostname()
will return differnet values. This can also be seen in the
differece in the hostname command output.

[stack@cyborg-2 ~] hostname
cyborg-2
[stack@cyborg-2 ~] hostname --fqdn
localhost

as a result on a host without an fqdn set in /etc/hostname
or an fqdn set via dhcp/dns using socket.getfqdn() will
result in 'localhost.localdomain' where as socket.gethostname()
will result in 'cyborg-2'

This is required to have the correct default behavior so that
cyborg and discover and the parent placment resouce provider
corresponding to the current host.

Change-Id: I1687043dc2469343878cfeb466703eb9d4099ad0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/71/714971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support extras in Glance Store install

Recent change to devstack dropped installing test-requirements [1]
However, this caused gate failures due to lack of glance-store
deps for cinder and swift support.

This patch makes devstack install relevant extras depending on
enabled features.

Additionally, relevant functions are added/fixed to make this
possible.

glance-store = glance_store (for gerrit search match)

[1] https://review.opendev.org/715469

Change-Id: I0bf5792a6058b52936115b515ea8360f6264a7c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/35/715835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local glance_store_extras=() if is_service_enabled cinder; then glance_store_extras=("cinder" "${glance_store_extras[@]}") fi if is_service_enabled swift; then glance_store_extras=("swift" "${glance_store_extras[@]}") fi setup_dev_lib "glance_store" $(join_extras "${glance_store_extras[@]}") else # we still need to pass extras pip_install_gr glance-store $(join_extras "${glance_store_extras[@]}")

commit_message:
Stop using Octavia network driver

We shouldn't be using Octavia components except octavia-lib
in provider driver.
For now we only use Neutron client methods from Octavia Neutron network
driver, so this patch removes use of Octavia network driver
in favor of direct use of Neutron Client.

Change-Id: I77802ff65f975f8136daddfe897ae1993bd9c5e9

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded dns_nameserver

DNS nameserver is already defaulted in Heat, we should not need to pass
any default value in the client

Change-Id: I01b41f65b1c8607a27ec8658e239a708516fa1d9
Signed-off-by: ArchiFleKs <lefevre.kevin@gmail.com>
